thread.title: European stocks climb for sixth day after dovish Fed minutes
thread.title_full: European stocks climb for sixth day after dovish Fed minutes - MarketWatch

author: Sara Sjolin
title: European stocks climb for sixth day after dovish Fed minutes
text:
European stock markets rose across the board on Friday after minutes from the Federal Reserve indicated the U.S. central bank is in no rush to raise interest rates.
The Stoxx Europe 600 index SXXP, +0.72% jumped 0.7% to 364.06, setting it on track for a sixth straight session of gains, which would be the longest winning streak since mid-July.
The optimism in European stock markets comes after a shockingly bad U.S. labor market report out last Friday fueled expectations the Fed won’t start to tighten monetary policy this year. Minutes from the central bank’s Sept. 17 meeting — held before the lackluster jobs report — supported that notion. In the minutes, released Thursday after European markets closed, policy makers expressed concern over the weak inflation outlook in the U.S. and slowing global growth.
Resource rally: Hopes the Fed will push a rate hike into 2016 sparked sharp advances in commodities on Friday. Crude oil CLX5, +2.02% was trading above $50 and copper HGZ5, +3.52% rallied more than 3% to $2.41 a pound.
Shares of resource companies jumped on the back of that. Anglo American PLC AAL, +6.55% rose 4.9%, Fresnillo PLC FRES, +4.47% added 4%, and BHP Billiton PLC BLT, +3.19% BHP, +2.40% BHP, +2.40% gained 3%.
Glencore PLC GLEN, +8.12% GLCNF, -5.67% 0805, +7.44% shot 6.8% higher after the commodities and trading giant said it would cut its zinc production by a third after a collapse in prices of the industrial metal . Zinc prices surged to a three-week high after the Glencore announcement.
Among oil-related companies, shares of Tullow Oil PLC TLW, +7.97% climbed 6.7%, A.P. Moeller-Maersk AS MAERSKB, +2.90% added 2.6%, and Total SA FP, +1.83% TOT, +0.70% gained 1.5%.
Indexes: The U.K.’s FTSE 100 index UKX, +0.74% was up 0.6% to 6,411.69. The benchmark is set for an eight straight day in positive territory, buoyed by the recent rally for resource companies.
Germany’s DAX 30 index DAX, +1.12% gained 1% to 10,087.23, while France’s CAC 40 index PX1, +0.88% added 0.9% to 4,717.45.
Other movers: Shares of ArcelorMittal MT, +6.47% jumped 6.9% after J.P. Morgan Cazenove lifted the steelmaker to overweight from neutral, according to Dow Jones Newswires.
Shares of Norsk Hydro ASA NHY, +6.69% gained 4.7% after Goldman Sachs raised the Norwegian aluminum maker to buy from neutral. Norsk Hydro said Friday it has signed a letter of intent to buy a further 40% stake in Brazilian bauxite producer Mineracao Rio do Norte.
SABMiller PLC SAB, +0.37% SBMRY, +0.41% added 0.3% after the brewer upped its cost-savings target by over $550 million . The move is seen as the company’s latest attempt to underscore the strength of its business in the face of a takeover approach by Anheuser-Busch InBev NV ABI, +1.06% BUD, -0.24%
